thread.title: Bronwyn Bishop 'considering her position'

author: Post to Linkedin
title: Bronwyn Bishop 'considering her position'
text:
Tony Abbott, Bronwyn Bishop and a wedding guest at Liberal Sophie Mirabella's wedding. Rebecca Hallas "I understand that the Labor Party will seek to use this to destabilise question time and I'm sure Speaker Bishop will take that into account as she considers her position," she said.
Even further fuelling speculation over her future, Social Services Minister Scott Morrison said the Speaker is "consulting with colleagues" when asked whether she still had his confidence.
"The Speaker is consulting with her colleagues and I think that's the appropriate place for those discussions to take place," he said.
Mr Morrison then failed to defend Mrs Bishop when quizzed over whether she should have to produce evidence of official meetings that she claims coincided with her taxpayer-funded trips.
 After 2 interesting tram trips last night now on the 109 on Collins St to Sth Cross to get the train to Geelong to visit @SHendersonMP
— Malcolm Turnbull (@TurnbullMalcolm) July 28, 2015 "I can understand the justifiable angst that Australians have about this issue...And it's important for us all, I think, to be accountable around our entitlements," he said.
The Prime Minister's office said there were no moves afoot to sack the Speaker who was personally chosen by Tony Abbott.
The government is preparing for Parliament's resumption dogged by questions over her expenses claims for a helicopter flights to Geelong and now two private weddings.
News Corp has reported that Mrs Bishop charged taxpayers $288 in travel allowance to stay in Brisbane on the night of Liberal MP Teresa Gambaro's wedding in 2007.
At Sth Geelong station with @SHendersonMP before going to Torquay to inspect the @NBN_Australia rollout. pic.twitter.com/PWJI7dBNAD
— Malcolm Turnbull (@TurnbullMalcolm) July 28, 2015 This follows Labor demands for Mrs Bishop to explain what parliamentary committee business she was undertaking when she claimed $600 for return flights from Sydney to Albury, to attend the wedding of former MP Sophie Mirabella in 2006. Other members of the committee have said her travel was not authorised by them and they never received an official report from her.
Other attendees at that wedding, including Tony Abbott, wrongly claimed expenses but repaid the money. Mrs Bishop is refusing to do so.
Mrs Bishop's office said her claim of $288 to attend Ms Gambaro's wedding was legitimate, as she met with an academic in the same field of a parliamentary committee she was chairing - who she said wants to remain anonymous.
The spokesman said committee chairs do not need prior approval for travel and do significantly more work than committee members.
He also said Mr Morrison did not say he did not support her.
Mr Turnbull took to Twitter to show himself using public transport to travel from Melbourne to Geelong, the same journey Ms Bishop chose to take by helicopter for a Liberal Party fundraiser.
Labor leader Bill Shorten said "the soap opera has to stop".
He said Mrs Bishop was Mr Abbott's captain's pick and he should have acted straight away.
"Mr Abbott has to act, Bronwyn Bishop has to go," he said.
"This mess has infected both of them."
.
